item.title: Galaxy Z Flip 7 Makes Zero-Profit Play, Samsung Sells Foldable Cheaper Than Its Own Galaxy S25
item.content:encoded:
The Galaxy Z Flip 7 has become the phone that style enthusiasts actively desire and creates excitement in ways that standard flagship phones simply cannot match. The compact clamshell form factor when folded delivers visual impact that surpasses even iPhone’s polished design language, and transforms phones from utilitarian tools into fashion statements.

At $899 for the 256GB model, down from $1,099, and $1,019 for the 512GB version, down from $1,219, both configurations have hit record-low prices on Amazon for Black Friday that undercut traditional premium flagships. This seventh-generation foldable now costs less than many conventional flagship phones and delivers Samsung’s most refined folding experience yet.

See at Amazon

Dual Display System

The large 6.9-inch internal Dynamic AMOLED 2X display unfolds to reveal a proper smartphone screen running at 2520 x 1080 resolution with 120Hz adaptive refresh that shifts smoothly between 1Hz and 120Hz depending on the content. This primary display boasts HDR10+ for vibrant colors, going up to a peak brightness of 2600 nits that ensures perfect readability even in direct sunlight when its competitors all wash out completely. The external 4.1-inch Super AMOLED cover screen is a significant evolution from earlier tiny external screens, offering real utility for notification checking, music control, taking selfies, and running widgets without opening the phone. This cover display boasts a 1048 x 948 resolution and a matching 120Hz refresh for smooth interactions that make quick tasks possible without the unfolding ritual that earlier Flips required for everything.

The Samsung Exynos 2500 processor is built on an advanced 3nm manufacturing process and brings flagship performance with 10 cores that include high-performance Cortex-X5 cores reaching 3.3GHz. In practice, this processing power takes on-demand games, 4K video editing, and heavy multitasking without experiencing the thermal throttling or battery drain seen by earlier foldables that tried to pack flagship specs into severely constrained thermal envelopes.

This includes a dual-camera system with a 50MP main sensor featuring optical stabilization and 12MP ultra-wide captures for stunning photos that easily rival traditional flagship cameras, notwithstanding the engineering constraints of fitting quality optics into a folding form factor. Meanwhile, the f/1.8 aperture lets in substantial light for excellent performance in low light, while optical stabilization ensures sharp handheld shots even in challenging conditions. The ultra-wide lens captures expansive landscapes and group photos without the distortion that ruins cheaper implementations. Video recording tops out at 4K at 60fps, with enhanced stabilization for smooth footage when walking or shooting actively.

A 4300mAh battery capacity represents an upgrade over past generations while an efficient 3nm processor and adaptive display refresh come together to deliver all-day battery life through typical usage patterns. The 25W wired charging replenishes the battery relatively fast, though it lags some competitors that offer 65W or faster. The 15W wireless charging offers cable-free convenience, and the reverse wireless charging lets you top up the Galaxy Buds or another Qi-compatible device just by placing it on the back of the phone.

For less than the traditional premium phone price, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 manages to deliver unique folding design, dual 120Hz displays, flagship Exynos 2500 performance, capable cameras and all-day battery life at this record Black Friday price on Amazon. Samsung’s seventh-generation refinement eliminates the compromises that made earlier foldables feel experimental rather than practical daily drivers.

See at Amazon

item.title: Logitech Pushes MX Master 3S Wireless Mouse Into Black Friday Giveaway Mode After Last Month’s Sales Wipe Out Most Stock
item.content:encoded:
Take a moment to look down at your desk. What does your setup look like? How’s your keyboard? Are your speakers up to par? How many monitors are you using? When it comes to PC gaming, there’s virtually endless potential for upgrading your space. From the heart of your system—the GPU, CPU, and RAM—to the various gaming accessories like a mechanical keyboard or a high-quality surround sound headset, building your ultimate gaming setup can be a gradual process. One often overlooked accessory in this journey is the mouse. Sure, that cheap $10 one you picked up at the checkout counter last time you were at Staples gets the job done, but a mouse can be so much more than you might realize.

The Logitech MX Master 3S will kick your computer use up a notch, when gaming or otherwise. It’s normally listed at Amazon for an even $100, but this early Black Friday deal has the mouse discounted by 20%. It doesn’t take a mathematician to tell you that ends up saving your $20, bringing the price down to just $80 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

This high-precision gaming mouse is capable of 8K DPI tracking on any surface. You can even use the Logitech MX Master 3S smoothly across glass. Sensitivity is fully customizable so you can set it to your own personal sweet spot.

Clicks are quiet so you can work or game actively without disrupting anyone else in the room with you, be they co-workers, roommates, or your family. Even though its been made to significantly more quiet than other elite gaming mice on the market, this one still gives you that same satisfying, tactile feeling when clicking the button down.

Ultra-fast Scrolling

The Logitech MX Master 3S gaming mouse makes use of MagSpeed scrolling. It’s fast, precise, and near silent. You can scroll up to 1,000 lines in one second, easily.

This mouse has an ergonomic design so you can work comfortably with a more natural wrist posture. Your thumb rests on the side of the mouse where it also has access to a second scrolling wheel and two programmable buttons you can set with app specific profiles. This way you can optimize your workflows while also making your gameplay more efficient.

Do note that this is a Bluetooth Edition of the gaming mouse. That means it only supports connectivity over Bluetooth and does not come with any USB receiver, adapter, or charging cable. The Bluetooth Edition of the Logitech MX Master 3S gaming mouse has been knocked down to $80 from $100.

You can also opt instead to grab the model which comes with a USB receiver. This one is on sale for $20 off as well, bringing the price down from $120 to just and even $100 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

item.title: Amazon Quietly Liquidates Ugreen Nexode 65W, 4-Port Fast Charger Almost Free Now
item.content:encoded:
Modern life requires charging multiple devices at once and most homes and offices don’t have anywhere near enough outlets or good-quality chargers to keep phones, laptops, tablets, and accessories all charged up simultaneously. A compact multi-port charger consolidates the charging infrastructure into a single hub that eradicates adapter juggling and outlet competition and offers fast charging across all connected devices.

At $24, down from $39, Ugreen’s four-port Nexode 65W charger has reached a record-low price on Amazon for Black Friday that suggests a zero-margin pricing that’s purely aimed at driving volume sales during the critical shopping period. This aggressive discount makes premium GaN charging technology accessible to everyone rather than remaining a luxury for tech enthusiasts.

See at Amazon

65W Power for Laptops

The maximum 65W output provides enough power to charge MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, Dell and other USB-C laptops at full speed rather than the trickle charging that lower-wattage adapters deliver. A MacBook Air reaches 51% battery in just 30 minutes when using the full 65W through a compatible cable: this makes quick charging practical during brief work breaks or morning routines.

The four-port configuration, including three USB-C outputs and one USB-A input, covers every device type you’re likely to carry daily without requiring multiple chargers or adapters. You can charge your laptop off one USB-C port while simultaneously powering your phone off another USB-C port, your tablet off the third USB-C port, and older accessories such as wireless earbuds or fitness trackers off the USB-A port. Intelligent power distribution automatically adjusts wattage allocation based on the requirements of the devices connected to ensure optimal charging speeds, rather than equally splitting power without regard for actual needs.

The compact dimensions of just 2.64 x 1.65 x 1.5 inches make for a charger small enough to slip into jacket pockets or laptop bag compartments without the bulk that makes larger chargers a pain to transport. This size reduction compared to traditional laptop chargers comes courtesy of GaN technology that allows higher power density in smaller packages thanks to running cooler and more efficiently than silicon-based designs. Foldable prongs collapse flush against the body to avoid snagging on bag contents or causing damage to other items during transport.

Besides size reduction, GaN technology provides safety due to better thermal management and prevents dangerous overheating that has plagued cheap chargers with outdated component designs. Improved efficiency means less energy is converted to waste heat during operation, keeping the charger cooler during extended use while reducing fire risk. Built-in protections against overcurrent that could damage sensitive device circuits, overvoltage spikes resulting from unstable power grids, and short circuits from cable damage or debris in the ports are included.

This covers universal compatibility with MacBook Pro and Air, iPhone 15/16/17 series, Samsung Galaxy S24/S25, Google Pixel 9/10, iPad Pro, Steam Deck, and virtually any USB-C device compatible with Power Delivery fast charging standards. That cross-compatibility breaks the iOS versus Android divide in which you’d have to use different chargers for different ecosystems.

For $24, the Ugreen 65W charger delivers a total of four ports, including three USB-C, GaN technology, and 65W laptop charging capability. Now 39% off retail this Black Friday, Amazon’s aggressive pricing suggests margin sacrifice for volume during peak shopping season.

item.title: Persona Director Says ‘JRPG 3.0’ Is Coming To Re-Shape The Genre ‘At A Fundamental Level’
item.content:encoded:
People talk about turn-based role-playing games and JRPGs the way academics fret about the novel. Much ink is spilt over what defines the form and whether it’s dead, only for a great piece of work to come along and briefly revitalize hope that it’s as alive and relevant as ever. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was this year’s jolt of lightning, proving turn-based RPGs still have some gas left in the tank, but Persona director Katsura Hashino seems to think the genre’s best days are still ahead.

The lead developer behind Metaphor: ReFantazio and Persona 5 recently gave a talk at the G-Star 2025 gaming conference in South Korea with the heady title ‘When experience becomes memory – designing lasting impressions through art and structure’ in which he argued there are three main eras of the JRPG, according to a report by 4Gamer that was translated by Gamesradar.

According to Hashino, JRPG 1.0 encompasses the “true classics,” which seems to include everything from the NES through at least PS2. Then there’s JRPG 2.0, which refers to the modern era of the genre. The director doesn’t seem to specify the boundaries, but lets peg it at Persona 4 through ReFantazio, a period which Hashino describes as being “higher quality due to how much more responsive they are to the player.”

Most importantly, there is “JRPG 3.0,” which refers to the next generation of games that haven’t yet been defined. How will the genre stay fresh in this new era? “There will be a greater dimension to these games and they’ll change the genre’s structure and presentation at a fundamental level,” he says, according to Gamesradar.

Is Clair Obscur the future or the past?

I have no idea what any of this means, but I’m excited that Hashino seems excited. He doesn’t sound dogmatically wedded to the past or necessarily burnt out on what has become a very successful but somewhat predictable formula for Atlus RPGs. Will that push the team to try and reinvent the wheel a bit with Persona 6, or whatever P-Studio has coming in the future? I certainly hope so.

There’s been a meme going around aimed at lampooning self-identified JRPG fans who sometimes seem to pretend like nothing good came out of the genre between Final Fantasy VII and Clair Obscur. But there’s a kernel of truth in both stances. There have been plenty of great JRPGs during this period, and they weren’t just called Persona. The Xenoblade Chronicles are a particular bright spot, while Trails, Tales, and other series have grown bigger as well.

This is unironically how some of y'all treat this genre https://t.co/pL8tIDXfcU pic.twitter.com/wwswKZrRS0

— Red (@kitsuneredFES) October 24, 2025

But it’s also true that Clair Obscur has pulled in lapsed fans in a way few other games have. A timeline with only FFVII and Clair Obscur on it is JRPG erasure, but it’s probably a not entirely inaccurate picture of your average casual gamer’s relationship to the genre.

The French GOTY front-runner is in many ways a very traditional turn-based role-playing game, but it has just enough unique twists on old tropes and mechanics to feel bold and novel. It recontextualizes the past more than it points to some revolutionary future, but maybe, as with Metaphor and other turn-based games experimenting around the fringes, it can be a bridge to something new. Or maybe I, like a lot of fans, just want to be tricked into feeling like what we’re nostalgic for is actually doing something fresh.

item.title: WD 5TB Portable External Hard Drive at $0.02 per GB Shows Black Friday Is All About Clearing Stock, Not Profit
item.content:encoded:
You have enough on your mind during the holidays, why not free yourself from the fear of your laptop or desktop meeting with a catastrophic demise and taking all of your precious data and files with it? There’s a Black Friday deal for that right now at Amazon — save $30 off the price of the 5TB model of WB’s Elements portable external hard drive for Windows or Mac. Take a quick break from shopping for family and friends and give yourself the best gift of all — peace of mind.

That might sound extreme, but saving yourself from losing your data and files due to a massive hardware failure, an accident, or even an act of nature is well worth the new $110 price tag on the 5TB WB Elements. Many of the items on your PC or Mac are probably irreplaceable, like digital family movies or digitized photos, official documents that you’ve scanned into digital form, work files, archived emails, and more. A fast backup to a reliable portable hard drive is an essential step toward keeping your files safe, and the WD Elements is among the very best.

See at Amazon

The Size and Speed You Need

The 5TB capacity of this WB Elements portable external hard drive is likely more than enough to back up your entire desktop or laptop, and possibly consolidate any files you’ve had floating around on thumb drives or smaller external hard drives. The longest file transfer is always the first one, but the WB Elements drive moves at USB 3.0 speed up to 5Gbps while also being retro-compatible with USB 2.0 devices. You should note it’s a USB-A device, not USB-C.

All those files may be hogging hard drive space on your computer, but the WB Elements backup drive will most definitely not hog space on your actual desktop. It’s a tiny, sleek device measuring only 3.2 by 4.35 inches and a scant 8.32 ounces, so it’s literally pocket-sized and more than able to hitch a ride in your backpack or briefcase.

The drive comes formatted for Windows 10, 8.1, and 7.1 for plug-and-play usage. It’s also Mac-compatible after a quick and easy reformatting process that your Mac or MacBook will walk you through.

Steal of a Deal

The full range of WD Elements portable external hard drives, ranging from 1TB to 6TB, are beginning to hit Black Friday pricing. But this 5TB model is by far the best deal so far at 21% off its regular $140 price. If you’re really concerned about keeping your files safe, a great way to take advantage of this awesome deal is to buy two WD Elements drives, with one intended to be stored somewhere away from your home in case of fire or other natural disaster.

WD’s rep as one of the best storage drive manufacturers has been decades in the making, starting with the My Book line that debuted in 2006. The 2007 model My Book was one of the first terabyte-sized drives to hit the consumer market. The physical size of these drives has shrunk dramatically while the storage levels have soared, and the prices have never been friendlier than they are now. Hit this Amazon Black Friday deal on the 5TB WD Elements drive for just $110 and sleep easier knowing your files are safe and secure.
